resources.string: This is the example of Fragments. A Fragment represents a behavior or a portion of user interface in a FragmentActivity. You can combine multiple fragments in a single activity to build a multi-pane UI and reuse a fragment in multiple activities. You can think of a fragment as a modular section of an activity, which has its own lifecycle, receives its own input events, and which you can add or remove while the activity is running (sort of like a "sub activity" that you can reuse in different activities). Rotate the phone to landscape mode to view another fragment.
Stack View: Swipe down on the stack for popping the top image from the stack & swipe up on the stack for pushing the previous popped image back to the stack.
This is an example of Tab View implemented via Fragments, FragmentPagerAdapter and ViewPager.
This is a sample project of some concepts of the android. Tap the button on the left side of the toolbar to select any option from the navigation menu.

This is the landscape layout of the fragment. Infact, this whole app is build on the concept of fragments build for each navigation menu option & then, nested fragments are used to further render views on the main activity screen.
